remarks: Removing identical parts from the end of a line segment preserves congruence.  Theorem 4.3 of [Schwabhauser] p. 35.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)
statement:
tgbtwncgr.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tgbtwncgr.m $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
tgbtwncgr.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tgbtwncgr.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tgbtwncgr.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
tgbtwncgr.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
tgbtwncgr.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
tgbtwncgr.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
tgcgrsub.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. P ) $.
tgcgrsub.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. P ) $.
tgcgrsub.1 $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( A I C ) ) $.
tgcgrsub.2 $e |- ( ph -> E e. ( D I F ) ) $.
tgcgrsub.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- C ) = ( D .- F ) ) $.
tgcgrsub.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( B .- C ) = ( E .- F ) ) $.
tgcgrsub $p |- ( ph -> ( A .- B ) = ( D .- E ) ) $.
